snippet: Kipnis, the Cleveland Indians’ second baseman, has ivy in his blood: “I dreamed about, as a kid, playing in the World Series at Wrigley Field.”...
abstract: Cleveland Indians second baseman Jason Kipnis, Chicago-area native and lifelong Cubs fan, is now committed to extending team's 108-year World Series drought; two-time all-star's older sister was classmate of Steve Bartman, who many blame for prolonging Cubs agony by interfering with foul ball in 2003 National League Championship Series game.
lead_paragraph: Kipnis, the Cleveland Indians’ second baseman, has ivy in his blood: “I dreamed about, as a kid, playing in the World Series at Wrigley Field.”

headline.main: Once a Die-Hard Cubs Fan, Jason Kipnis Is Now Trying to Extend Their Misery
headline.print_headline: Now an Indian, Then a Cubs Fan With a Family Friend: Bartman
